noun.description: As much as the heart can hold or contain; as much as a person wants or can endure.

adjective.description: Characterized by deep emotion or sincerity of expression; genuine, sincere, heartfelt. Of an emotion: deeply or acutely felt; intense.

origin: Late 16th century. From heart + -ful<br>late Middle English; earliest use found in Robert Mannyng (d. c1338), poet and historian. From heart + -ful.
